title: Dozens of volunteers canvas Boston for homeless people outside as blizzard bears down on the city
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Pine Street Inn outreach teams canvas Boston with supplies for homeless during a blizzard, offering transport to shelters.
16 inches of snow fell on Boston as a nor’easter hit, with outreach efforts seeing fewer people on the streets.
Boston shelters, with a 585-bed capacity, accommodated over 660 people, remaining open 24/7 during harsh weather.

title: 50 percent of departing Boston Logan Airport flights canceled Tuesday
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Over 50% of departing flights from Boston Logan Airport were canceled due to a powerful nor’easter striking New England.
The storm resulted in nearly 1,000 flight cancellations Monday and suspended Amtrak service from Boston to New York.
MassPort advises travelers to check with airlines as flights could continue to be delayed due to weather conditions.

title: To trade or not to trade? Bruins must make their call with Viktor Arvidsson.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Viktor Arvidsson has become a key player for the Bruins with 14 goals and 28 points in 45 games.
Boston Bruins hold a 61% chance of making the playoffs, facing a decision whether to trade Arvidsson by March 6.
Trading Arvidsson could yield draft assets but may affect Bruins' playoff chances and team dynamics this season.

title: These Mass. schools are closed on Tuesday, Feb. 24.
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Massachusetts schools are closed on February 24 due to a snowstorm, affecting over 80 districts including Boston and Cambridge.
The snowstorm has brought over 30 inches of snow to some parts of Massachusetts, causing widespread school closures.
Several school districts such as Athol-Royalston and Littleton announced delays rather than closures due to the snowstorm.

title: AJ Brown recalls ‘critical’ Mike Vrabel moments that changed hatred to respect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: AJ Brown reflected on his evolving relationship with coach Mike Vrabel during a 'Dudes on Dudes' podcast episode.
Brown initially disliked Vrabel, writing 'I hate [Vrabel]' during meetings, but later grew to respect his coaching style.
Vrabel's insistence on accountability helped Brown achieve six 1,000-yard seasons, starting with his rookie year in 2019.

title: US women’s hockey declines invite to State of the Union, men’s hockey also invited in viral Trump phone call
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: US women's hockey team declined President Trump's State of the Union invite due to scheduling conflicts post-Winter Olympics.
US men's hockey team, also invited, is expected to attend after winning gold against Canada in overtime.
Several players from both teams face schedule conflicts as NCAA and PWHL resume post-Olympics play.

title: Patriots cut running back Antonio Gibson to save cap space
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots cut Antonio Gibson to free over $3 million in cap space, absorbing $1 million in dead money.
Gibson, injured in 2025, played 22 games for Patriots, contributing 644 rushing yards, 212 receiving yards, and 3 touchdowns.
Patriots seek new running back to support Rhamondre Stevenson, TreVeyon Henderson after Gibson's release.

title: Yes, this storm is officially a blizzard. Here’s what meteorologists want you to know.
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: The National Weather Service declared a blizzard in Massachusetts and Rhode Island, affecting Boston and Providence, as of Monday morning.
Blizzards are characterized by heavy snow, visibility below 1/4 mile for three hours, and winds of 35 mph or more.
NWS warns of hazardous travel conditions and potential power outages due to winds possibly reaching 75 mph and falling snow.

title: Video captures blizzard conditions in downtown Boston
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Jack Coen captures heavy blizzard conditions in downtown Boston with nearly whiteout conditions and powerful gusts.
The National Weather Service forecasts 18 to 24 inches of snow in some Massachusetts areas with strong winds.
Snow accumulates at 1Lofts mill apartments in Pawtucket, R.I., measuring 14 inches as of Monday morning.

title: Tom Brady’s WWE comments have landed him at the top of Randy Orton’s RKO list
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Randy Orton joked about hitting Tom Brady with an RKO after Brady called pro wrestling 'cute' on Logan Paul's podcast.
Tom Brady and Logan Paul are set to compete in the Fanatics Flag Football Classic with several NFL stars.
Randy Orton will participate in his 10th elimination chamber match, aiming for a shot at Wrestlemania 42.
